main event: Two air-men observed a luminous light in Death Valley, California while on a Z-23 observation on 2 September 1952.
interesting points: The light was visible for approximately 30 minutes and pulsed or fluctuated in brightness., The light was estimated to be at an altitude of 30,000 to 40,000 feet., The light appeared to be two times the size of the B-29 tail stabilizer., Four crewmembers observed the light, which was the only object accompanying their aircraft., The crew described the object as potentially a reflection of some type.
witness description: crew members of the Z-23 observation aircraft
